problems.title: Huffman Encoding - Calculate Weighted Path Length
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N characters and their frequencies.
Build a Huffman tree and calculate the total weighted path length.

Huffman Tree Construction (Greedy):
1. Create a leaf node for each character with its frequency
2. Repeatedly merge the two nodes with smallest frequencies:
   - Create a new internal node with frequency = sum of the two
   - The two nodes become children of this new node
3. Continue until only one node remains (the root)

Weighted Path Length = Sum of (frequency[i] * depth[i]) for all characters
This represents the total number of bits needed to encode all characters.

Note: The weighted path length equals the sum of all internal node values.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
5 9 12 13

Sample Output
78

Explanation:
Frequencies: [5, 9, 12, 13]

Step 1: Merge 5 and 9 -> Node with frequency 14
Step 2: Merge 12 and 13 -> Node with frequency 25
Step 3: Merge 14 and 25 -> Root with frequency 39

Total cost = 14 + 25 + 39 = 78
